baseline_models.name: LightGBM Localized Per-Store
baseline_models.rationale: Fastest training (20x vs neural nets), superior accuracy on tabular data, excellent for individual store-level modeling
baseline_models.implementation_notes: Train separate model for each store or store cluster. Handle missing values by keeping as sparse. Use recent research finding: non-imputed localized models outperform imputed.

baseline_models.name: XGBoost Global with Store Features
baseline_models.rationale: Kaggle 1st place winner used 20+ XGBoost models. Proven R²=0.87 in retail applications. Extensive hyperparameter options.
baseline_models.implementation_notes: Encode stores as features or use embeddings. Follow 1st place approach: 50% time on feature engineering, 40% on feature selection + ensembling.

baseline_models.name: Random Forest + Linear Regression Ensemble
baseline_models.rationale: Fast interpretable baseline. Random Forest for feature importance analysis, Linear for speed and interpretability.
baseline_models.implementation_notes: Use RF feature importance to guide feature engineering. Linear model provides interpretability for business stakeholders.

refinement_candidates.name: LightGBM with Optimized Features
refinement_candidates.refinement_strategy: Use ablation study results to select top features. Optimize hyperparameters on critical features only.

refinement_candidates.name: XGBoost Ensemble (Multiple Configurations)
refinement_candidates.refinement_strategy: Following 1st place Kaggle winner: Create 20+ XGBoost models with diverse configurations. Each should achieve competitive score individually.
refinement_candidates.ensemble_method: Weighted average based on validation performance

refinement_candidates.name: Entity Embeddings Neural Network
refinement_candidates.condition: Use if ablation studies show high-cardinality categorical features (Store, StoreType) have high impact
refinement_candidates.rationale: 3rd place Kaggle solution. Maps categorical variables to continuous embedding space. Discovers latent relationships.
refinement_candidates.expected_improvement: Competitive with tree-based methods; provides embedding insights

refinement_candidates.name: Temporal Fusion Transformer (Optional)
refinement_candidates.condition: Only if dataset size >100k samples and computational resources available
refinement_candidates.rationale: 2025 SOTA for time series. Scaling laws: accuracy improves with data volume. May underperform tree-based on smaller datasets.
refinement_candidates.expected_performance: Potentially competitive if data volume sufficient; likely slower than tree-based
refinement_candidates.implementation_notes: Use only if tree-based models plateau. Requires substantial computational resources (GPU recommended).

ensemble_architecture.name: Stacked Ensemble with Bayesian Averaging
ensemble_architecture.strategy: Following Kaggle winners: Combine multiple strong individual models
ensemble_architecture.validation_strategy: Out-of-fold predictions for Level 2 training to prevent overfitting

high_priority_features.rationale: Strong weekly and seasonal patterns in retail sales

features: Same day of week from previous 1-4 weeks
high_priority_features.rationale: Historical patterns strong predictor. Winners spent 50% time on feature engineering.
Store characteristics drive baseline sales levels

feature_engineering_priorities.feature_engineering_time_allocation: 50% of total effort (following 1st place winner strategy)

validation_approach.description: Train on historical data, validate on subsequent 6 weeks

holdout_test.usage: Never used during training/tuning. Only for production validation.

missing_values.competition_data: Impute with large value (no competition) OR create 'missing' category
missing_values.recommendation: Follow 2025 research: Non-imputed localized models may outperform imputed

outliers.detection: IQR method, domain rules (store closures), statistical methods
outliers.handling: Investigate before removing. May be legitimate patterns (special events).
outliers.approach: Robust scaling, separate modeling for outlier periods

data_cleaning: Check for data leakage (no future information in features)

key_insights_from_research: Feature engineering > model complexity (50% time allocation per 1st place winner)
Localized per-store modeling outperforms global models (2025 research)
Tree-based models (LightGBM/XGBoost) consistently beat neural nets on tabular data
LightGBM: 20x faster training, superior accuracy on localized data
Ensemble diversity matters: 20+ XGBoost models (1st place) or 15 models (2nd place)
Entity embeddings effective for high-cardinality categoricals (3rd place innovation)
Non-imputed localized models > imputed models (recent finding)
Transformers require large datasets; may underperform tree-based on smaller data
references: Gert Jacobusse (1st place): 20+ XGBoost ensemble, 50% time on feature engineering
Nima Shahbazi (2nd place): 15-model ensemble, innovative feature discovery
Cheng Guo (3rd place): Entity Embeddings, arXiv:1604.06737
